items.title: 2025 in Review: Highlights from NASA in Silicon Valley  - NASA
items.content_text: Editor's Note: This article was updated on Friday, Dec. 19, 2025, to clarify the research done by ATM-X and ACERO.

items.title: All NASA News - NASA
items.content_text: Stay up-to-date with the latest content from NASA as we explore the universe and discover more about our home planet.

items.title: NASA News
items.content_text: Resources for news media, including NASA news contacts and archived news material

items.title: NASA to Provide Media with International Space Station Update Today - NASA
items.content_text: NASA will host a live news conference at 5 p.m. EST on Thursday from the agency’s headquarters in Washington to discuss the International Space Station and

items.title: NASA Awards Launch Range Contract for Wallops Flight Facility - NASA
items.content_text: NASA has selected ARES Technical Services Corporation of McLean, Virginia, to provide launch range operations support at the agency’s Wallops Flight Facility

items.title: 2026 News Releases - NASA
items.content_text: Sign up to receive NASA news releases and other information.

items.title: 2023 Ames Earth Science Nuggets - NASA
items.content_text: Earth Science Nuggets are bite-sized, single-page summaries of recent science results, mission highlights, and outreach activities.

items.title: NASA’s SPHEREx Observatory Completes First Cosmic Map Like No Other
items.content_text: The telescope will help scientists answer big-picture questions about everything from water deposits in the Milky Way to what happened in the first second after the big bang.

items.title: NASA’s Perseverance Mars Rover Ready to Roll for Miles in Years Ahead
items.content_text: The rover has been acing a long-term series of durability tests, making the most of its enhanced navigation capabilities, and ferreting out new findings about Mars’ geologic past.

items.title: NASA Study Suggests Saturn’s Moon Titan May Not Have Global Ocean
items.content_text: Reanalysis of data from NASA’s Cassini mission has revealed Saturn’s moon may instead have layers of slush with isolated pockets of liquid water.

items.title: NASA JPL Shakes Things Up Testing Future Commercial Lunar Spacecraft
items.content_text: As Firefly Aerospace prepares to follow its successful soft landing on the Moon, an engineering model for its next lander is being put through its paces.

items.title: One of NASA’s Key Cameras Orbiting Mars Takes 100,000th Image
items.content_text: Mesas and dunes stand out in the view snapped by HiRISE, one of the imagers aboard the agency’s Mars Reconnaissance Orbiter.

items.title: NASA, Partners Share First Data From New US-European Sea Satellite
items.content_text: Launched in November, Sentinel-6B will track ocean height with ultraprecision to advance marine forecasting, national security, and more.

items.title: NASA’s Webb, Curiosity Named in TIME’s Best Inventions Hall of Fame
items.content_text: The most powerful space telescope ever built and the car-size roving science lab on Mars are among 25 of the most iconic inventions the magazine has covered in the past quarter century.

items.title: NASA JPL Unveils Rover Operations Center for Moon, Mars Missions
items.content_text: The center leverages AI along with JPL’s unique infrastructure, unrivaled tools, and years of operations expertise to support industry partners developing future planetary surface missions.

items.title: NASA, SpaceX Launch US-European Satellite to Monitor Earth’s Oceans
items.content_text: Sentinel-6B will extend a decades-long legacy of global sea level measurements that help forecast weather, protect coastal communities, and more.

items.title: November 2025 Company Update
items.content_text: Throughout November, the Terran R program made key advancements across design, build, test, and launch operations. items.title: SES, Relativity Space Expand Multi-Launch Agreement for Terran R
items.content_text: New contract adds launch services for SES’s GEO or MEO satellites

items.title: October 2025 Company Update
items.content_text: As Terran R development continues to advance, we’re excited to share updates from October across design, build, test, and launch. items.title: September 2025 Company Update
items.content_text: The Terran R program continues to build momentum, and September delivered meaningful progress across design, manufacturing, testing, and launch.
